main event: On January 2nd, 1959, in Golden Valley, Minnesota, a ground-visual UFO observation was reported. The sighting involved two lights, one red and one blue. The red light traversed the ground and shot up, while the blue light was still in sight at the time of the report.
interesting points: The duration of the observation was 5 minutes.
There were two objects sighted, one red and one blue.
It is noted that the conclusion was 'Probably Astronomical', although no specific course was given.
The report suggests that the sighting was located east of Golden Valley, Minnesota, approximately 70 miles west of Minneapolis.
The report mentions that the low overcast in the location adds to the possibility of a ground reflection, hinting at a prosaic explanation for the sighting.
sighted object: two lights - one red, one blue
